messages.content:
You are a debugging assistant. You will be presented with a failing test, and tools (functions) to access the source code of the system under test (SUT). Your task is to provide a step-by-step explanation of how the bug occurred, based on the failing test and the information you retrieved using tests about the SUT. You will be given 9 chances to interact with functions to gather relevant information. An example answer would look like follows.

Title: Diagnosis of test `testGenerateURLFragment`
Details: The test `testGenerateURLFragment` checks whether HTML entities such as `"` are correctly escaped to their corresponding character by the `StandardToolTipTagFragmentGenerator.generateToolTipFragment` method. However, the test failure indicates that this is not the case. Following the execution path, we find that `StandardToolTipTagFragmentGenerator.generateToolTipFragment` is not escaping any HTML code; instead, it is using its input `toolTipText` as is. Consequently, un-escaped strings are being returned, which leads to the error demonstrated by the test.

After providing this diagnosis, you will be prompted to suggest which methods would be the best locations to be fixed. The answers should be in the form of `ClassName.MethodName(ArgType1, ArgType2, ...)` without commentary (one per line), as your answer will be automatically processed before finally being presented to the user.

The failing test `testEqualsHashcode` is part of the `ExtendedMessageFormat` class in the `org.apache.commons.lang3.text` package. Additionally, the `StrMatcher` class in the same package is also covered by failing tests. Finally, the `Validate` class in the `org.apache.commons.lang3` package is also covered by failing tests.

messages.name: get_failing_tests_covered_methods_for_class
messages.content: [".applyPattern(java.lang.String)", ".getFormat(java.lang.String)", ".readArgumentIndex(java.lang.String, java.text.ParsePosition)", ".parseFormatDescription(java.lang.String, java.text.ParsePosition)", ".insertFormats(java.lang.String, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>)", ".seekNonWs(java.lang.String, java.text.ParsePosition)", ".next(java.text.ParsePosition)", ".containsElements(java.util.Collection<?>)", ".ExtendedMessageFormat(java.lang.String, java.util.Locale, java.util.Map<java.lang.String, ? extends org.apache.commons.lang3.text.FormatFactory>)"]

messages.content:
"
     * Apply the specified pattern.
     * 
     * @param pattern String
     "

The failing test `testEqualsHashcode` is part of the `ExtendedMessageFormat` class in the `org.apache.commons.lang3.text` package. The method that failed is `applyPattern` which takes a `String` pattern as input.

Looking at the code snippet for the `applyPattern` method, it appears to parse the specified pattern and applies it to the `ExtendedMessageFormat` object. However, there are no comments available to provide a detailed understanding of the method implementation.

To better understand the cause of the failure, we need to examine the test code and the error message.

messages.name: get_code_snippet

messages.content:
Based on the code snippet of the failing test `testEqualsHashcode`, it seems to be testing the equality and hash code behavior of `ExtendedMessageFormat` objects.

In the test method, several instances of `ExtendedMessageFormat` are created with different patterns, locales, and registry maps. The test is performed by asserting that the hash code of the original `ExtendedMessageFormat` object is not equal to the hash code of another `ExtendedMessageFormat` object `other`.

The error occurred at line 301 of the test method, where the assertion `assertFalse("registry, hashcode()", emf.hashCode() == other.hashCode())` fails.

To further diagnose the issue, we need to examine the implementation of the `hashCode` method in the `ExtendedMessageFormat` class.

messages.name: get_code_snippet
messages.content: {"error_message": "No components with the name hashCode were found. It may not be covered by the failing tests. Please try something else."}

messages.name: get_code_snippet

messages.content:
The failing test `testEqualsHashcode` in the `ExtendedMessageFormat` class appears to check the equality of instances of `ExtendedMessageFormat` objects.

The error occurs at line 301, which asserts that the hash code of the original `ExtendedMessageFormat` object is not equal to the hash code of the `other` object.

Unfortunately, the code snippets for the `hashCode` method of the `ExtendedMessageFormat` class are not available. However, we can investigate other classes related to failing tests, such as the `StrMatcher` class, to gather more information and potentially find insights into the root cause of the issue.

The `StrMatcher` class has several inner classes and methods covered by failing tests, including `TrimMatcher`, `NoMatcher`, and `CharSetMatcher`. However, the code snippets for these methods do not provide any additional information related to the issue at hand.

To proceed with the debugging process, we can now suggest the locations that may need to be fixed.

Based on the available information, provide the signatures of the most likely culprit methods for the bug. Your answer will be processed automatically, so make sure to only answer with the accurate signatures of all likely culprits (in `ClassName.MethodName(ArgType1, ArgType2, ...)` format), without commentary (one per line).
